a.title: Parents Please Update Your Contact Information Here!

strong.span: Parents Please Click Here to Update Your Contact Information!

div.h2: AT HOME Remote Learning, VIDEOS & rESOURCES

span.span: Have you Registered for school? Please call 508-997-4511 Ext. 14601

p.br:
We are committed to developing a community of learners who are academically proficient, demonstrate strong character and exhibit self confidence. As whaler's oil provided light to the world, so shall New Bedford students shine with academic excellence.
COVID-19 UPDATES
SPECIAL EDUCATION COVID-19 UPDATES

div.div: New Bedford Public Schools has partnered with STEAM the Streets to create a content campaign to showcase how our community is stepping up during the COVID-19 pandemic.
A message to NBPS staff from Superintendent Anderson.
div.a: Read More about Thank You NBPS Staff

div.div: Students interested in the NBHS 8th Grade Dual Enrollment Program can apply 100% online! The submission deadline has also been extended to May 22, 2020. Don't delay, apply today!
div.a: Read More about 8th Grade Dual Enrollment

div.div: Please click "Read More" for a message from Superintendent Thomas Anderson

div.div: Please click "Read More" for a message in your language of choice!

div.div: Please click "Read More" for important schedule changes to the Grab n’ Go meal distribution.
div.a: Read More about Grab n’ Go Schedule Changes

div.div: Remote Learning Packets by grade are available to download from the top of our Homepage. Also, don't miss the "Focus on Learning" series out now!

strong.span: Please send public comments for School Committee Meeting to:

br.span: Anonymous emails will not be accepted and all emails must include your name, address and subject. Emails that do not include this information will not be submitted to the School Committee. Comments must be submitted no later than 30 minutes prior to meeting start.

table.style: border-color: rgb(192, 0, 0); border-width: 3px; border-style: solid; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;

br.span: New Bedford Public Schools intends to apply for continued funding of 21st Century Community Learning Centers programming for both the Alfred J. Gomes Elementary School (Out of School Time) and Normandin Middle School (Out of School Time) under Title IV Part B, 21st CCLC. NBPS will notify the community if funding is awarded and provide additional information at that time. Specific questions should be directed to the respective schools.
